characters: WE SMASH CUT BACK TO THE MEDICAL WING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HEAVY NIGHT MIST swirls around the imposing stone walls the Bastille. PRISON GUARDS patrol outside with their pik as the SCREAMS OF PRISONERS echo out the barred windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of huge PRISON GUARDS walk down a row of filthy pr cells. Whimpering, starving PRISONERS appear and disappea the flickering light of the wall torches. A large rat nib some stale bread in the corner, watching the guards. Finally, the two guards reach a cell whose PRISONER is no all whimpering or starving. A huge Scotsman with a proud defiance in his eyes, a RED SQUARE MEDALLION dangling aro his neck, glares through the bars. This is JAMES McCULLEN The guards unlock his cell door, MATCHLOCK MUSKETS at the ready. McCullen stares at the muskets, unimpressed. He sp with a thick Scottish brogue.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Still using matchlocks, are ya? I can get you a pair of flintlocks, you let me sneak out of here. Everyone else in this sequence speaks with a French accen

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (TEMPTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good ones? The other Guard glares at him. McCullen goes for the kill

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: The best. From Spain. And perhaps a couple of pretty young ladies to teach you how to use them. Guard #1 is even more tempted, but his partner is a Loyal

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: On yer feet, you Scottish pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge, sweaty, bare-chested PRISON WORKERS mould something a furnace, a large chunk of metal in their red hot tongs. two prison guards muscle McCullen into the room and start fasten him to a standing rack as a PRIEST begins reciting Lord's Prayer in Latin. The Warden steps up and reads the charges off a SCROLL OF PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: James McCullen, you have been found guilty of treason for the sale of military arms to the enemies of our Lord King Louis XIII... even whilst you sold arms to our Lord himself.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Your King is a vile bag of filth who murders his own allies. I should've charged him double.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: You tried to overthrow the Crown in conspiracy with its enemies!

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: They offered me a Chancellorship, because unlike your simpleton King, they know that is the McCullen destiny, to run the wars, the true power, not simply to supply arms.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: Do you have anything else to say before the sentence is carried out?

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Clan McCullen is far bigger and more powerful than any of you could ever imagine. My sons will continue to rise along after I am gone. As will their sons. And, God willing, their sons. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shall not end with my death. The Warden smiles back sinisterly.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: Oh, we're not going to kill you, McCullen. We're going to make an example of you.

The Warden gives a nod to the prison workers who remove t METALLIC OBJECT from the fire. McCullen sees what it is before we do and his face fills with fear. It's a METAL M being carried towards him, the hinges open with a hideous creak. McCullen begins to struggle against the rack.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that no man, woman, nor child may ever see your treacherous face again, you shall wear this mask for the term of your natural life. The mask closes around his face. The workers melt the loc McCullen SCREAMS. AND WE PUSH IN on the RED SQUARE MEDALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The many flags of NATO flap outside its massive headquart

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: War used to be the exception. Now it is the new state of play, a constant, unavoidable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RED SQUARE MEDALLION around the neck of JAMES McCULLE gazing over a lectern in a darkened room. Like his doomed ancestor, McCullen carries a proud defiance in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Tragic as they are to fight, wars must be won. But perhaps they don't have to be as destructive as they've been in the past. A SERIES OF COMPLEX SCHEMATICS rolls continuously on a sc behind him. McCullen is briefing twenty-two NATO MILITARY COMMANDERS, many of them listening in TRANSLATION HEADPHO

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nano-mites. Perfect little soldiers. Their size can be programmed as well as their intended task. Originally developed to isolate and destroy cancer cells, but at Mars Industries, and with the help of a little NATO funding...
A few laughs around the room. McCullen soaks it up.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .we discovered how to program them to eliminate most anything. For instance... metal. ON SCREEN: A SOLDIER fires a shoulder-launched missile at tank. The warhead bursts into millions of SILVER MICROSCO NANO-MITES which eat away the metal like piranhas devouri horse. Then the NANO-MITES fan out from the consumed tank quickly head for a nearby jeep.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once the target has been destroyed, the launcher triggers a kill switch unique to each warhead that short- circuits the nano-mites, preventing any unwanted destruction. ON SCREEN: The Soldier hits a KILL SWITCH on the launcher the NANO-MITES instantly "drop dead" around the nearby je

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Each warhead contains seven million nano-mites and has the ability to eat anything from a single tank to an entire city. (to consummate salesman) But without innocent casualties. Which is why this has been such a priority for me and my company. The room breaks into APPLAUSE. FOCUSES ON GENERAL HAWK, a British veteran or countless battles, not buying it.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Guess you'll be the first arms dealer up for the Nobel Peace Prize. Laughter in the room. McCullen smiles, being a good sport

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: I prefer the term "armament solutions engineer" (more chuckles) Gentlemen! I'm pleased to announce that tomorrow morning your first order of nanotech warheads will ship from my factory in Kyrgyzstan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR GLASS-LIKE WARHEADS, each the size of a softball, ar placed into four separate compartments inside a WEAPONS C by a pair of LAB WORKERS. The KILL SWITCHES are secured n to each warhead. As the case is closed and locked we see MARS Industries RED SQUARE MEDALLION LOGO on its cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF DOG TAGS drop INTO FRAME in SLOW MOTION. We see name: "HAUSER, CONRAD R." Still not seeing his face, we w our soldier strap into his BODY ARMOR and clip on his BAT HARNESS. His NAME TAG simply reads: "DUKE". He loads his the mirror (is that a look of disdain?) and we get our fi glimpse of our hero, a handsome, rugged combat veteran wi BATTLE SCAR under his right eye. The sound of RETCHING comes from the stall behind Duke. T is a flush and a strapping young Special Forces Soldier, STALWORTH, steps out. He goes to the sink next to Duke an splashes water on his face. He's pale and sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: The hell's wrong with you, Stalworth, you didn't eat that Chicken A La King at chow did ya?

dialogues.speaker: STALWORTH
dialogues.text: The mission, sir...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: What about it? Another day, another run.

dialogues.speaker: STALWORTH
dialogues.text: Never had anything to worry about before. Stalworth's shaky hand pulls a photo out and shows it to Duke: A YOUNG MOTHER with a NEWBORN in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: STALWORTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three weeks old. Be seeing him for the first time next leave. Duke looks at the picture, then at Stalworth. His eyes go distant thinking about his own past, then they harden aga

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You're off the mission.

dialogues.speaker: STALWORTH
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: That's what you want, right? Stalworth doesn't argue. Duke hands him back the photo.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If your head's with them, you're no good to me. Stalworth nods. Duke steps closer, now one mean s.o.b.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One thing, though: you step off this one, you're out of Special Forces. Gonna find you a nice desk and chair back at the base. You're be run of the mill. Regular.

dialogues.speaker: STALWORTH
dialogues.text: I... I guess I can live with that.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Then you should. Stalworth nods, grabs his kit, and leaves. Duke's hard ey watch him go, then a slight smile creases his lips ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCullen exits the briefing room into the corridor outsid shaking hands with various Military Commanders. Hawk watc with his aide, a gorgeous German Lieutenant, COURTNEY "CO GIRL" KRIEGER. When McCullen is alone, Hawk makes his mov

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Mr McCullen, Clayton Aernathy, British Army.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: (shaking hands) I know who you are General hawk. As sharp in a briefing room as your reputation is on the battlefield.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Not hardly ...You gave me a broad target, I couldn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: It's an honor to meet a man of your many accomplishments. McCullen smiles, then offers Hawk to walk with him.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, General?

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Your warheads. Securing them in transit. Forty pairs of ears in that room now know the when and where.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Those "ears" all have top security clearance.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: We both know what that's worth.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Look, General, delivery is my responsibility and it's not one I take lightly. I had NATO assign an elite American Special Forces unit, a fully armored convoy with air support. I assure you, my warheads will be quite safe.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I've made a career of showing up where I'm needed, whether ordered to or not. And if your warheads are half as effective as you say they are.. Then my unit is needed.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: This is no time to play catch up. The NATO team's been drilling for weeks. They're lit up and ready to roll.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: My unit doesn't need mission specific training. They're chosen because of their ability to handle any situation.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Maybe next time, General... (moves to go, stops) What did you say your unit was called?

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I didn't. I just said they were always ready. McCullen continues on down the hall. Hawk gives Cover Gir look, she reads it and nods. WE SMASH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FOUR MAN SECURITY DETAIL escorts two LAB WORKERS as the enter a high-tech delivery bay and wlak past two "COUGAR" PATROL VEHICLES and a huge ARMORED "GRIZZLY TRUCK, all ar with state-of-the-art rooftop weapons. FIFTEEN SPECIAL FO SOLDIERS stand at attention in front of Duke.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: All right, listen up, the Cougars will be front and back, Grizzly in the middle carrying the package. Minimum distance at all times. Choppers will cover us overhead. The Lab Workers step up.

dialogues.speaker: LAB WORKER
dialogues.text: Captain Hauser. Duke turns to them and start signing forms as WALLACE "RIPCORD" WEEMS takes the case while a little short on academic credentials, Rip is long on confidence, charm, a courage. These two guys are as close as brothers, for bet and for worse. Rip looks at the Lab Guy with a jokey grin

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Not gonna explode, is it?

dialogues.speaker: LAB WORKER
dialogues.text: (dead serious) They're not weaponized yet. And the kill switches are attached to the launchers. All the same, I'd avoid potholes if I were you. Ripcord stares, then quickly hand the case off to another soldier. Duke shoots him a look and Ripcord shrugs, what?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Why not stick it in a chopper and fly it out? If you want, I could--

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: --We have our orders. Okay, people! We're on the clock, let's move.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNT UP
dialogues.text: Duke gives Rip another look. Rip throws him a cheesy grin The team mounts up. The weapons case to Grizzly. ENGINES ignite. HEADLIGHTS beam. And the convoy rolls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy charges out of the heavily guarded factory gat passing a sign: "MILITARY ARMAMENTS RESEARCH SYNDICATE". BLACKHAWK HELICOPTERS swoop in and follow the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripcord drives the lead Cougar, Duke beside him. Two more guys in back, remotely panning a rooftop DUAL MACHINE GUN

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (into radio) Mother Goose, this is Bird Dog. We have the package and are on the dot to make Ganci Air Base ar 0900.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: You know, I hate all the Mother Goose, bird Dog crap, I just wish they'd let us say, "Hey, Pete, it's Bill, see ya in a few."

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Not me, I joined up for the jargon.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON RADIO
dialogues.text: Roger that, Bird Dog. Mother Goose out.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Just saying, you know, if I ran things...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Rip, if you ran the Army we'd stay up all night, fill our canteen with tequila, and call each other "Bro".

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: But we'd be badasses, right Bro?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (with a sigh) Yeah, we'd be badasses. Eyes on the road, Rip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Blackhawks sweep through the skies, silhouetted b the rising sun. Below them, the convoy is thundering down winding road amid the magnificent Tian Shan Mountain Rang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RADAR DISH on the rear Cougar sweeps vigilantly. Inside SPECIAL FORCES SOLDIER watches the RADAR MONITOR, clear except for two steady :signatures", the Blackhawks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lead Cougar, Duke and Ripcord keep their eyes out.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Hey Duke, ya know how they always tell you to empty your head of distracting thoughts on these runs?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes on the road, Rip.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: And you know how people sometimes joke that it must be easy fr me to keep my mind empty?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Don't listen to 'em. you got plenty of thoughts up there. (into radio) Keep rear security tight, boys.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Well, the second I try and make myself not have thoughts, I always have 'em. Like now, know what I'm thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Please don't say the Air Forces.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: The Air Forces.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I thought we were done with that discussion.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: You were done with it, not me. Look, I loev flying... Duke "mouths" the following sentence as Ropcord says it:

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've been flying since I was thirteen years old. Ripcord shoots him a look. Duke just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I don't think your daddy's crop duster counts as hours logged.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Jets, man, jets. You know I always qualify when I'm on leave.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, look, you want to get up in the air, we'll get you a trampoline back at the base.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: We've done ten years in the Army, I just think we should see if the grass really is greener.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: This continues to be the stupidest idea you've ever come up with, nd that's saying something.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Funny. Real funny.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I don't wanna transfer to the Air Force, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: It's always about you, isn't it? Give me one good reason?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I want to be in the fight, not flying over it.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Won't be saying that when you call in an air strike and I come screaming in to save your--

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: --Eyes on the road, Rip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the Blackhawks and the convoy an ominous, DARK SHA suddenly drops INTO FRAME. ENGINE EXHAUST blurs our view the aircraft, but we can tell that it's pursuing the conv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the rear Cougar's RADAR SCREEN, we see the two Blackha signatures still appearing in position.. .but nothing els

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit a pothole. Ripcord grimaces, then realizes--

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Hey, on the training run weren't there herders around here? This puts Duke instantly on the alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. CONCUSSION CANNONS slide out of ports on both s of the dark shape. They fire simultaneously. The SUBATOMI BLASTS punch into the front Blackhawk, crushing it like a beer can on your forehead. It explodes and drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Rip see the hall of flaming metal crash in front them, blocking the convoy's path. Rip hits the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Bird Down!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (urgent, but utterly calm) Back up! Back up! Back up! (into radio) Mother Goose, this is Bird Dog. We are under attack. Repeat --we are under attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second Blackhawk pivots to see the dark shape, --it's like a giant helicopter without rotors, hovering on six J THRUSTERS. It's a next-gen "TYPHOON" GUNSHIP. The Blackhawk hoses the Typhoon with its six-barrelled MI GUNS. But the rounds bounce off the Typhoon's angled armo The CONCUSSION CANNONS fire at the second Blackhawk, catc it on the nose, crushing it into a flaming ball and sendi it reeling ass-over-tail-rotor into the ground behind the rear Cougar, hemming in the convoy. The Grizzly launches two HEAT-SEEKING MISSILES off its ro turret, but the Typhoon guns them down and fires again. T blast lands directly on top of the rear Cougar, literally flattening it as well as every tree within a hundred feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke sees it all in his rear view mirror, yells into RADI

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Out! Everyone get out of the vehicles! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final CONCUSSION BLAST lands between the last two vehic now. Spinning the Grizzly. It's WINDOWS SHATTER and a thousand lethal GLASS SHARDS shoot inside, killing the drivers. The Cougar flips end over and lands in a ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Ripcord land on the upturned ceiling, beat to sh Duke quickly checks on the two guys in back crushed to de where the blast caved in the Cougar's armor. He looks at

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: (DAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, except for all the blood. Duke sees blood on the back of Rip's head. Then they hear LOUD ROAR and turn to see the Typhoon hover by the Grizzl

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that? Duke grabs Ripcord and starts dragging him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIDE DOOR on the Typhoon hisses open to reveal six "VIPERS", menacing foot soldiers clad head to toe in blac BATTLE ARMOR, and armed with fearsome PULSE RIFLES. They the Typhoon and spread out to kill anyone left. The decimated Special Forces troops in the Grizzly OPEN F with ASSAULT RIFLES, but the bullets can't penetrate the Viers' armor. The Vipers fire back, the impact from their pulse rifles crush the soldiers' bodies, armor and all, a fling them backwards. Two Soldiers pop two FRAGMENTATION GRENADES and toss them toward the Typhoon. The Vipers shoot one grenade out of t air with their pulse rifles. It EXPLODES well out of rang the other grenade lands on the ground int he middle of th pack. Another shot from a pulse rifle punches the grenade feet underground. A DULL WHOOMP, lifts the ground by a fo Meanwhile, another figure emerges out of the Typhoon. Lon slender legs in high black boots, the rest if her covered black, form-fitting BODY ARMOR. She's beautiful, exotic, most of all, lethal. She's known in certain circles only "THE BARONESS" but we will know her as ANA. Her DARK GLAS glint menacingly as she strides towards the Grizzly. The two Special Forces Soldiers who threw the grenades po to shoot her. But she quick-draws a pair of PULSE PISTOLS BOOM! BOOM! The shots crush both soldiers.

Ana flips the pistols back into her holsters as a Viper b the back door off the Grizzly, allowing her to climb insi She blithely steps around the corpses and removes the WEA CASE. Duke now has Rip ver his shouders and is running like hel

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Duke?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: If I die...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You're not gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: I just want you to know... you never could run worth a damn.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Rip.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, it's be nice if you could move a little faster. And that's when the Cougar blows, a concussive blast. Ana turns with the weapons case in time to see Duke and Rip g ass-over-teacups down into a ditch. She touches the stem her glasses which ZOOM IN on Duke. DOWN IN THE DITCH: Duke rolls over and looks at Rip.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: (really messed up) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I'm gettin' that package. Duke leaps up and hauls-ass down the ditch, then crouch-r up the embankment. --And comes face to face with a Viper, raises his pulse rifle, about to blow Duke away. A hand clamps down over the barrel. The Viper looks at Ana beside him. Duke also looks at her flash of shocking recognition ripples across his face.
Ana touches the stem of her glasses and the DARK LENSES t clear, revealing her gorgeous eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell...? Her face softens hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Hello, Duke... Then she round house kicks him with her boot across the f knocks him out on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to admit you had that coming. Ana struggles with something going on inside her head. Th her face reluctantly hardens and she takes her hand off t first Viper's gun barrel, giving Duke an apologetic look.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Duke. Duke can't believe it. Ana suddenly glances up at somethi behind Duke. It's a "HOWLER" TRANSPORT rocketing onto the scene, its four-winged JET THRUSTERS rotating ninety degr to slow it into a hover. Duke takes the opportunity to ju to his feet and lay out in the Viper. Ana turns and hauls ass. A BLACK-CLAD FIGURE fast ropes down out of the Howler and lands behind a Viper and SNAPS his neck. Moving in a blur draws and buries a KATANA BLADE into another Viper. Then glances at the last Viper who's lining up on him, too far away to reach with his sword. He quick-draws a GLOCK PIST BAM! Right between the eye slit in his helmet. All this i the space of six breathless seconds. Duke glances at the almost mystical figure of SNAKE-EYES sheathing his sword on his back while holstering his smok Glock. RED NINJA CLAN MARKING on his tri-cep. Bad-ass defined. Snake-Eyes leaps behind the Cougar wreck as a pu burst just missed him. Duke immediately takes off after A his eyes locked on the weapons case in her hands, PULSE BURSTS crackling past his head. He curses under his breat

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Air Force.. .right.

A Viper lines up on Duke, but a laser-like ARROW BOLT rip through his eye-slit and ELECTROCUTES him, courtesy of SH "SCARLETT" O'HARA who fast-ropes down from the Howler, holding a gas-propulsion CROSSBOW PISTOL. She lines up on another Viper, but he's too quick, ducks behind the GRIZZ But Scarlett's CROSSBOW PISTOL viewfinder snapped an imag his FACE ARMOR. She darts behind the COUGAR WRECK with Sn Eyes, swiftly targeting the Viper's eye-slit on her pisto LED SCREEN. Then she fires behind her, in the complete ot direction to the Viper, the arrow bolt flies away, then t around and zeroes in on the Viper, finding him behind cov the smart-arrow slams right through his eye-slit. Another Viper sees this and bolts toward the Typhoon, but LAMONT "HEAVY DUTY" MORRIS leans out of the landing Howle holding a dual MACHINE GUN/GRENADE LAUNCHER. Only a man t big can carry such a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: Time to lay down some bass! He fires a grenade and the Viper flies back OUT OF FRAME. blink, you miss it. BOOM! The Typhoon fires at Heavy Duty but the Howler is just as nimble, fires its LEFT-SIDE THRUSTERS which roll it onto its side. The CONCUSSION BLA whip past and decimate the forest behind it. Hanging awkwardly, Heavy Duty fires a double blast of hand grenad The Typhoon's mini-gun quickly shoots them out of the air The Howler fires MISSILES which hit the CONCUSSION CANNON and rip them apart. The Typhoon SHAKES. Ana races for the recovering Typhoon. Duke races after her through a hail o pulse-fire and draws his PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Ana! She whirls around, drawing the weapons case over her ches and face, using it as a shield. Duke hesitates, because o the warheads or Ana? Heavy Duty goes to shoot at her.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: The warheads! Heavy Duty reluctantly doesn't shoot, everyone watching A backpedal towards the waiting Typhoon. Duke charges like bull and tackles her. Ana sprawls and the case tumbles fr Duke and Ana go eye-to-eye for a split second, then Duke after the case while the Joes take the opportunity to spr gunfire her way. Ana zigs, zags, and dives into the Typho which is raked by the bullets.

Duke grabs up the case as the Typhoon launches into the s and disappears over a rise ... SILENCE... Scarlett, Snake-eyes and Heavy Duty now approa Duke, who whirls around at them, pistol up, eyes wild.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Stand down! Stand the hell down!

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: Lower your weapon, Sir. We're not the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Pointing weapons at me doesn't make you my friend. ABEL "BREAKER" SHAZ jumps out of the Howler wearing a computerized SURVEILLANCE SUIT, a French/Tunisian ACCENT:

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Please hand over the case, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are, and I sure as hell don't know who they are, and until I find out, I'm not lowering anything or handling anything over. CLICK-CLACK. They turn to see Ripcord shouldering a rifle

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: What's your unit?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That's classified. Snake-Eyes discreetly grabs SHRUNKEN THROWING STARS from belt, but a look from Scarlett makes him out them back.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Someone would like a word with you. Breaker sets a holo-projector on the ground in front of D which projects a 3D IMAGE OF GENERAL HAWK. Duke is stunne

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: State you name and rank.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: .you first.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: My team just saved your life. now's the part where you say "thank you".

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Those aren't the words that come to mind just now. We weren't told about any support for this mission, so you better tell your team to stand down. Ripcord eyes his sight.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Happy to turn this into a turkey shoot. Someone OFF-PROJECTOR hands Hawk a file, he looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: You must be... Ripcord, expert marksman, weapons specialist, jet

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: (to Duke) Told ya.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I'm General Clayton Abernathy. You may have heard of me, .Duke. A glint of recognition flickers across Duke's eyes, he no

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: General hawk. Afghanistan, NATO Forward Command... Breaker sees his chance and gingerly steps up to Duke and starts sweeping a scanner across the case. Hawk smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: That was my last job. (a twinkle in his eye) I'm in a whole new outfit now. Duke swivels his gun to Breaker's head. Breaker flinches.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Just need to deactivate its tracking beacon, for security.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Hand over the weapons case son, and let us deliver the warheads.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: No way. I signed for 'em. My mission, my package. I carry them, I deliver them. Breaker's scanner BEEPS. He keys a button. The BEEPING promptly stops. He throws a look at Duke.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Wasn't hard, was it?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Fine. But you seem to be a little short on transportation a the moment. Team Alpha will deliver you to me.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And where exactly are you, General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawk stands in front of a HOLO-CAM amongst a sea of computers, Cover Girl behind him, Duke on a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Come see for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Howler skims over the GIANT PYRAMIDS OF GIZA, a carav of camels below. The aircraft continues out into the gold desert, too fast for anybody to get a good look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett is cleaning Ripcord's head wound.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Hey, you're cute.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He's going into shock.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: What's your name, darlin'?
Snake-Eyes stabs Ripcord hard int he arm with a drip-need Rip angrily eyeballs him and stifles a scream.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I thought all the Special Ops guys were tough.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: We are tough ... . but also sensitive. (feeling the drugs) Whoa, that's some mucho primo stuff you gave me. Rip is high now, his eyes float up to Heavy Duty who star back at him. Rip reaches out to touch his well-cropped ha

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .and a kung-fu grip.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: The name's Heavy Duty. Duke has the weapons case on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: What kind of outfit is this? Not regular Army based on the accents. (to Scarlett) I have you as an Aussie... (looks to Heavy Duty) And you're a Johannesburger... (then Breaker) And you: French North Africa. Algiers?

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Tunisia. Where were you born?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Duke wasn't born, he was Government-Issued!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: But somehow you're all in the same unit. One you can't tell me the name of right?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We'd get tossed for telling.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Duke, Duke, don't you get it: they're super secret, they're Mission Impossible. This tape's gonna self-destruct in five--

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: --You're gonna go after them aren't you? The ones that hit my convoy. (SILENCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then whoever you are, whatever this unit is, I want in.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Not our call. Ripcord sits up, really woozy, looks at Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: I want in too. That way we can spend some bunker time together. A SWORD suddenly slices across Rip's face, an inch away. Snake-Eyes, checking his blade, seemingly innocent. But t message is not lost on Ripcord. Scarlett looks at Duke.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You two a team or something?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: We've been together forever. (off her look) But not like that. Hi, I'm Ripcord.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Why do they call you that? Breaker laughs, reading Ripcord's file:

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Because his name is Wallace Weems!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight SECURITY TECHNICIANS sit around an island console i small, windowless room. Working their keyboards and watch the HOLOGRAPHIC IMAGE of the Howler soaring across the du A technician hits a LARGE SWITCH on his console.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Alpha-One, this is Base. You are cleared or entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a huge sand dune directly in front of Howler spirals to reveal a CAVERNOUS HOLE. The Howler's THRUSTERS twist vertical and it drops like a helicopter into the hole. SUPER: Global Integrated Joint Operating Entity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Howler descends beneath the surface onto a dark platf as the roof spirals shut and FLOOD LIGHTS switch on. The of the howler opens and the team steps out. Duke and Ripc follow hesitantly with the weapons case. A VOICE calls ou them from the shadows:

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Welcome to the new Pit! Duke and Ripcord turn to see hawk and Cover girl walking from behind the lights.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Duke.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: General.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I've read a lot about you two.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Okay, look, I didn't "steal" that Blackhawk, I was borrowing it... Duke shoots him a look. Hawk steps right up to Duke.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Matter of fact, I saw that one of my subordinates tried to recruit you to our little operation a while back.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I was never asked to join any Op group.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Remember a tall gentleman approaching you in Thailand when you were on leave, four years ago?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Right before you tore up the bar?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Four years? My man had some issues. Duke shoots him another look, then turns back to Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: This doesn't look like any Tac Op I've ever seen. Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Okay, you trusted me by going with my team, so I'll trust you. There's a loud METALLIC CLANG and part of the PLATFORM be to descend. They pass the URBAN COMBAT LEVEL where MEN an WOMEN are training with next-gen urban warfare equipment.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Technically, GI JOE doesn't exist. But if it did, it'd be comprised of the top men and women from the best military units all over the world. The alpha dogs... They see a pretty woman sip into a next-gen CAMO-SUIT, wh reflects and refracts light, making her nearly invisible.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Oh man, I want one of those.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: The suit or the girl?

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Both. Scarlett's eyes roll. They descend into the DESERT COMBAT level, where soldiers train with desert warfare equipment

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Ten nations signed on in their first year. Working together, sharing intel. Now we have twenty- three.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I've never seen combat gear this sleek, what's the trick?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Liquid armor. They reach the DEEP SEA COMBAT LEVEL where dozens of men women are testing fantastic next-gen UNDERWATER VEHICLES.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Good news is we've been pretty successful so far. The bad news is whenever we manage to shut down one organization, another springs up in its place.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Who could possibly fund all this?

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: Oprah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawk now leads the group into the Control Room where more TECHNICIANS man consoles. Duke still has the weapons case

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. McCullen's standing by, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Patch him through, please.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: So who hit us out there?

dialogues.speaker: COVER GIRL
dialogues.text: Currently unidentified.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: And how'd that bitch in leather get a jump jet like ours?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Whoever she is, she's clearly well- financed, with access to highly classified intel and state of the art weaponry. Their capabilities are beyond anything we've ever encountered.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: That's the reason we got our asses kicked. Duke betrays nothing. Hawk looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: We're going to need to find out everything we can about her. Knowing is half the battle.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: What's the other half? McCullen now appears next to Ripcord and walks through hi

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! And we realize McCullen is here courtesy of a HOLO-PROJEC A ring of cameras provides him with images of the Joes.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is James McCullen, CEO of MARS Industries, the man who built these warheads. WE INTERCUT THIS SCENE WITH McCullen standing in front of HOLO-CAM in a small room somewhere. THE HOLOGRAPHIC IMAGE hawk, Duke, and the others around him.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: General, most men I've encountered in this business over-promise and under-deliver. You're the opposite. Clearly, you were the security option I should have chosen. ON DUKE: Steaming behind his military demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: My team did everything we could out there. A lot of good men went down--

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: --But not you.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: That mission was classified, sir. Clearly, somebody sold us out.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: I've spent ten years and thirteen billion Euros creating these four warheads. Your job, Captain, was to protect them, and if it wasn't for General Hawk, you would've failed.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: That's not a fair assessment. He followed his orders to the letter.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Well that wasn't enough. Duke bristles. McCullen turns to Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are your coordinates? I'll have NATO send another special ops team to retrieve the warheads, company strength this time.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Apologizes, Mr McCullen. It's not that I don't trust you...I don't trust anybody.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're not a McCullen?

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I don't talk smooth enough to be a McCullen.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: You do just fine, General. Now, so the bastards who attacked you can't find you, you need to disable the tracking beacon hidden in the case.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: We already have.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Good man. So, can I count on you to deliver the warheads to NATO now?

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I think it unwise to expose them at the moment. This group might make another attempt. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HAWK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to find and neutralize them before we can consider moving your weapons.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Alright. But allow me to check the warheads to see if any have been damaged. Duke begrudgingly sets the case down. Breaker turns on hi suit's BALL-EYEPIECE. It goes into X-RAY MODE and we see NANO-MITES crawling around inside the four warheads.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open it, please.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: My scan says they're intact...

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: General?

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: What's the code? ON DUKE, listening carefully.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Five-two-nine-four-four-oh. Breaker enters the code. As the case opens, Breaker discreetly watches McCullen in his BALL-EYEPIECE SCANNER. McCullen runs his holographic fingers over the warheads. Satisfied, he turns to Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please keep me informed of your progress, General. Duke and McCullen share a quick glare. And then McCullen the feed. Scarlett notices concern on Breaker's face.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Breaker?

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: That bloke's Beta waves were going up, down, and sideways... I think he's hiding something. And off the faces of the rest of the group WE CUT BACK TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCullen turns as Ana appears on a HOLO-PROJECTOR behind

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: I spend five years setting this up. Wringing money out of NATO. This was supposed to be the easy part.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: If you'd let me stage the assault at your precious factory, we could have contained the situation.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: And lost the trust of our clients in the process? It had to be NATO's fault. (steps closer) What happened? Did you hesitate?

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: You're implying this was about some ancient history? That's as laughable as your Intel. What went wrong was the Joes appearing out of nowhere. He stares at her suspiciously, then softens.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Forgive me, jealousy isn't my strong suit.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Forget that, where are we now? Have you tracked the case?

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: They deactivated the beacon. I gave them a code to quietly re-arm it. McCullen hits a key, a SCREEN switches on, displaying A M OF THE WORLD. A BEACON LIGHT flashes over a spot in the Egyptian desert, grip coordinates blinking.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There it is. The infamous Pit.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: I will get those warheads back.
McCullen steps forward and lovingly caresses her face, hi hand going right through her. McCullen whispers menacingl

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: (diffusing the threat) If I were really there, I might actually let you touch me.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: (sly smile) I'll send a jet.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Business first. Besides, I'm married, remember? Her holo-form blinks off, leaving McCullen alone in the r

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Sometimes I really hate technology. He sighs heavily, then hears a VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It is most often used by those without honor. McCullen turns to see STORM SHADOW, a well-tailored Korea man whose soul has long since departed, standing on the o side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: There can't be any more mistakes. The schedule can't be compromised any further.

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW
dialogues.text: If you had sent me, it would be done.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: (walking towards him) I'm sending you now, Storm Shadow. To the Baroness's villa. .Make sure her commitment doesn't waiver. Storm Shadow nods, McCullen continues on THROUGH him. We realize Storm Shadow was a holo-proj. Storm Shadow vanish

McCullen steps up to a large oval perspex window. WE PULL BACK out of the window to reveal that he's riding through DEEP ARCTIC OCEAN inside a next-gen "TRIDENT" submarine. CAMERA KEEPS PULLING BACK to show the Trident approaching docking bay of a MASSIVE FACILITY built into the seabed u the jagged canopy of the POLAR ICE CAP. The place is defe by several HARPOON CANNONS and a fearsome TURBO-LASER. It breath-taking sight, but also a little frightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MARS LOGO is stamped on a pair of WATER-TIGHT DOORS. logo pulls apart as the doors open, allowing McCullen ins the docking back entrance. Waiting for him is a man known only as THE DOCTOR. His face hidden by a life-support mas that continually pumps air into his lungs and also mechanically helps him to speak without the vocal chords is missing.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Good to be back.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: we've been very busy. He gestures to TWENTY MERCENARIES or various ethnicities, standing at attention, not a single muscle moving among t These are NEO-VIPERS. The baddest of the bad.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: Is it working?

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You tell me. The Doctor beckons a waiting LAB ASSISTANT who rolls out glass case containing an eighteen foot long KING COBRA. t Doctor bends down and gazes at the snake.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The King Cobra is a magnificent creature. Its venom can kill a full grown elephant with a single bite. He rattles the case and the cobra HISSES at him, revealin its hood. The Doctor steps up to a Neo-Viper and shows McCullen an INCISION SCAR behind the Neo-Vipers' right ea

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We introduced into each subject one thousand cc's of the nano-mite solution. As expected, subjects became extremely ill and fell into a coma-like state for approximately forty hours. The Doctor produces a small HANDHELD DEVICE from his pock A FILE PHOTO of a Neo-Viper appears on the device's scree

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When they returned to sentience, brain scans showed complete inactivity in the self-preservation region of the cortex.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: English, Doctor. The Doctor keys a demand and that particular Neo-Viper st up and sticks his bare arm into the case through a portal

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: They feel no fear. The Neo-Viper grabs the cobra and squeezes, the cobra bit his arm, latching on, sinking its venom into his veins. T Neo-Viper doesn't even wince.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cortical nerve clusters revealed complete inactivity--

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: --Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: They feel no pain. The Doctor keys another command and the Neo-Viper obedien lets go of the cobra and removes his arm from the case.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frontal lobe concepts of morality are disengaged... No remorse...

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: And they are completely obedient?

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Of course. .The real world applications are endless.
The Neo-Viper's knees give out. McCullen watches curiousl WE SMASH CUT INTO the NEO-VIPER'S BITE WOUND where the WH VENOM is racing through a blinding labyrinth of veins.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The nano-mites will target the venom. STILL IN HIS VEINS we see hundreds of MICROSCOPIC NON-MIT rushing to meet the venom head on. Blocking it. Then swiftly pushing it back. All the way to the original fang holes. The venom seeps out of the holes and drips of the Neo-Viper's arm. He stands and returns to his place i line without a word. The Doctor looks at impressed McCull

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you tell me: is it working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor follows McCullen through various corridors.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: The science is staggering isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: You've done well. You've thrown the caber clear out of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: But research and science are expensive propositions. If I can make a suggestion..? McCullen stops and looks at him, there is something truly menacing and evil behind this Doctor's mask.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Selling one batch of warheads on the black market could fund--

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN
dialogues.text: --I appreciate your thirst for knowledge, Doctor. But this world is messy enough. Factions fighting and scrabbling for control, for resources, and it's only going to get worse as the century progresses. No. What the world needs is unification. Leadership. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It needs to be taken out of chaos by someone with complete control. He looks through a portal into a shadowy OPERATING CHAMBE where a brilliant but vicious looking MAN is being scanne SMART ROBOTS. This is ZARTAN. A Smart Robot begins to cha Zartan's fingerprints, which we see on a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My family was once this close to that kind of power... (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The French... Zartan CRACKS HIS KNUCKLES and gives McCullen a nod. McCu looks back at the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once I get my hands on the reins, the money will take care of itself. You'll be able to do all the research you want. McCullen strides off. The Doctor stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke, still holding the briefcase, stares at a PHOTO OF A from the ambush, now up on a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: We grabbed an image from Heavy- Duty's helmet cam. Ripcord looks stunned, he leans closer to Duke and whispe

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Hey, that's-- Duke cuts him off with a look. Breaker extracts a full 3D FRONT-VIEW of Ana's face from the photo. Then on an adjac monitor, he runs an endless series of PHOTOS OF WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Now we can run the face through an infinity scan.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: We have access to any photograph on any server anywhere in the world.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Everyone gets photographed in some way at some time. ATM machines, airports, crowd shots at a football game. We'll find her. Duke just stares at Ana's photo. Ripcord whispers quietly

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (not okay) .what happened to her? For once, Ripcord doesn't know what to say. Cover Girl wa in and hands a document to Hawk, who looks through it.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: From NATO. I am now the official custodian of the warheads. Your mission is complete. Once you hand it over, that is. Duke nods, hands over the case with a hint of defeat.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: When you move it, she's gonna come after you, you know that, right? (off Hawk's look) And with her Intel, and her toys... she'll find you.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: And your point is...?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You're going to go after her first. And I want to help.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Let us in on this, General. Our team just got wasted. I think a little payback is in order.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: You don't ask to be a part of GI JOE. You get asked.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You scouted me four years ago, now I'm ready. Let's have at it.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: I've lost men too, Captain. Good men. But attempting to--

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I know her.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You said knowing is half the battle. Well, I know who she is. Duke reaches into his pocket, pulls out a photo and shows Hawk. INSERT PHOTO: Ana, four years earlier, much softer looking, staring lovingly at Duke as they're about to kis

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Her name is Ana Lewis, and I can tell you everything you need to know about her until... four years ago. After that, well, obviously sa lot's changed. Hawk just stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawk sits down behind his desk and looks up at Duke, stil standing at attention.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Before this goes any further, I need to know what I'm dealing with, a man looking to settle a score, or a man who can put the mission first. Because the battlefield is the wrong place for emotion. (he pauses for effect) Could you kill her?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: If I had to.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Chances are you will. But if you flinch, hesitate even an instant... what I'm trying to say is, unless you can kill her graveyard dead I don't want you.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I can. (off Hawk's look) I signed on to deliver those warheads, General, and despite your present authority, I want to finish the job. Hawk regards him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: So tell me about her.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll start right here: I hope that vault is tight, because she always gets what she wants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK, BEEFED-UP SUV drives towards a magnificent mansi in the Parisian suburbs. Though the vehicle looks relativ harmless, we'll come to know it as a "SCARAB" attack truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana enters the mansion. SERVANTS take her coat as her handsome, sophisticated and well dressed husband, BARON L DECOBRAY, glides up to her, very French. They kiss warmly

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: Hello, darling.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: How is work at the lab?

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: Steady progress.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: So the Minister of Defense was pleased?

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: He was. You know I wish I could tell you more...

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: You were gone a long time. How were the shops in Monte Carlo?

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: I didn't get what I was after. They head up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: I suppose I should be grateful.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Most husbands would be.

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: Most husbands don't have such mysterious wives, they know exactly where they are and what they do.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: (TEASING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think they know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana throws open the double doors to her grand bedroom on high floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: I never get over how beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: (staring at Ana) Neither do I. She spots Storm Shadow standing in an ante room and quick spins to face her husband. She pulls Decobray close and kisses him. Storm Shadow makes a move, but ana warns him with her eyes, She finishes the kiss and looks at Decobra

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Let me change and freshen up and I'll meet you for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: DECOBRAY
dialogues.text: Of course. Decobray smiles at her and leaves. The smile falls from Ana's face as she spins around and heads for Storm Shadow

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW
dialogues.text: Mr. McCullen gave me explicit orders to sever the Baron's spine if he so much as touched you.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: He's my husband, of course he touches me. Tell McCullen to grow up. Besides, the Baron says his work in the lab goes much better after we've... touched. And that's the important thing.

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW
dialogues.text: I'll be accompanying you to retrieve the warheads this time. Along with some of the men the Doctor's been working on.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: (with distaste) The Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW
dialogues.text: We go at dawn. Storm Shadow turns and heads out through the doors. Ana Stands alone in her room now, she heads over to her dress and opens a hidden drawer. Inside is a SMALL BOX. She ope it carefully and gazes at an ENGAGEMENT RING inside. Something sad and lonely in her eyes... And WE FLASHBACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded military club. OFFICERS and ENLISTED dancing to orchestra. And there's Ana, the most beautiful woman in t room. Wearing a black dress. Slightly younger and with no of the cold viciousness she displayed earlier. She's danc with Duke who's wearing his officer's DRESS UNIFORM, repl with bars and medals. She laughs as Duke whispers somethi in her ear. She's in love. And so is he. Ripcord is in a booth, downing shots with four ENLISTED WOMEN. He has his arms around two of them and looks loade

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: My hot tub only holds four. (COUNTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke leads Ana outside onto a quiet verandah, the lights Washington shimmering beyond them. He suddenly kneels dow in front of her, an ENGAGEMENT RING in a box in his hand. Ana gasps with shock and joy, tears welling in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I've been wanting to do this before we deploy.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Duke...it's beautiful. It's too nice you lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Only time I'm buying one of these, so why not? They stare a each other, a touching beat. Then Duke screw up his face, worried?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, what do you say? She's too emotional to speak. And then they hear:

dialogues.speaker: REX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Say yes, you idiot...! Lieutenant REX LEWIS saunters up, MEDICAL INSIGNIA on his collar. The look on his face tells us he's happy for them

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .Before I tell my new brother-in- law what it's like to share a bathroom with you.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Thanks for killing the mood, Rex.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I was coming to offer you a ride back to post.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Time already?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: We go at oh-five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Is it WMDs? It is, right? That's why you're pulling Rex out of the

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Ana, we can't--

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Classified. Top Secret. Have to kill me if you told me, blah, blah, blah.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Speaking of classified information, you still haven't answered.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course it's yes. On one

dialogues.speaker: CONDITION--
dialogues.text: She grabs REX and pulls him down on his knees next to Duk

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Promise me that you won't let my genius egghead brother get hurt. (looks at Rex) He's the only family I've got left. (back to Duke) Promise me.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I promise. She smiles and holds out her hand. He threads the ring on her trembling finger. Rex smiles, but in his eyes is a gl of instability. Ripcord comes CRASHING OUT through shutte doors and sprawls out next to them, arms and legs akimbo.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Rip. Ripcord rolls over and yells back through the doors:

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: How was I supposed know she was married!? (then, notices the ring) Nice rock! Hey, are you proposing?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I'm done proposing.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: I already said yes.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Not official until you answer my question. Do you love my boy?

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Always and forever. Ripcord flips open his CELL PHONE and takes the photo of that Duke carries with him.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Now I've gotta find someone to love me, as many times as possible for the next three hours. WE PUSH IN ON THE PHOTO, then SMASH CUT BACK TO THE PRESE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Duke, watching Heavy Duty pulling out an ACCELERATOR S

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: If you want to join us, you'll need to be mission ready, Joe style. This is the Mark One Accelerator Suit.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: What's it accelerate?

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: You. It'll make you run faster, jump higher, and hit harder than any of your enemies. A TITANIUM BOOT slides over a shoe. COBALT MACHINE PARTS snap into place with a HISS over Duke and Rip's arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Head-to-toe turbo-hydraulics and highly-pressurized pneumatics. They both slap on aerodynamic, flying-wing HELMETS. Insid the CYBERNETIC POWER-UP with an ear piercing whine. LASER ENHANCED LED readouts scramble and fritz across their HUD

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: An advanced cybernetics heads-up display, feeding into your helmet. Duke checks out two gas-propelled GRAPPLING SPEARS and si WRIST ROCKETS around his right forearm.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two gas propelled grappling spears and six ten millimeter, hi- explosive, heat seeking, fire-and- forget rockers. Rip spins the twin barrels of a caseless SUBMACHINE GUN o his left forearm. A Cheshire grin spreads across his face

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And a nine millimeter, caseless submachine gun with six hundred rounds capable of firing all of them in thirty seconds. Duke and Ripcord are now buckled in, getting a feel for t FLEXIBLE, POLY-ALLOY SUITS. Ripcord glances at Heavy Duty

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: I just missed everything you said. (turns to Duke) How do I look? Pretty cool, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Ripcord run through and URBAN ENVIRONMENT OBSTAC COURSE, 3D HOLO-PROJECTION TERRORISTS lunging out at them The guys take them out one by one, never more than a spli second after they appear. The HOLO-PROJECTIONS fritz and die. They reach the end of the and a BUZZER SOUNDS. At th back, arms crossed, impassively taking it all in, is Hawk Scarlett approaches the guys with an ELECTRONIC CLIPBOARD

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Sixty-three seconds. Not Bad. But not good enough. Gotta get under a minute to qualify.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: What's the record?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Forty-five.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, Snake-Eyes?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No, me. Ripcord glances at Scarlett's CROSSBOW PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: You can do this whole course with that thing in forty-five seconds?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: If you're going to shoot at something, kill it. Otherwise take up knitting.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: When I want something, I don't just shoot at it... (steps close to her) When I get a target in my sights, I take it down. His meaning is clear. She holds his gaze, slaps a magazin into her CROSSBOW PISTOL and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Here. Go on. Try it.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want to show you up.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Oh, that's so thoughtful of you.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: What can I tell you? I guess I'm just a considerate, humble guy. You'll learn that about me.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I'm the "target in your sights," right? You've got ten rounds to "take me down".

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: They're training arrows. The most I'll feel is a little jolt.
Scarlett walks back and faces him. He glances aside at Du who is loving this. Ripcord readies the pistol. Scarlett darts left. He shoots and misses. She darts right. He misses.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: C'mon, Rip. Ripcord tries harder, genuinely doing his best. But Scarl us too fast. Ducking and weaving around Ripcord, as nimbl as a cat. Five more shots miss her. And now Ripcord's feeling the pressure. He waits for her to move. Fires. Sh leaps up onto a corner wall and the bolt passes underneat He fires again as she lands, ducks under it and rolls up him. He fires his last bolt point blank. She catches it i her left hand by the stem as it leaves the chamber. Slamm her body up against his. Right hand behind his head, left hand holding the bolt. Their faces close. Lips closer. Ripcord's eyes on hers as he whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Guess you didn't really want me that bad, rip. She holds his eyes a moment longer, then lets him go. As walks away, Scarlett casually tosses the ARROW, it hits t ground and EXPLODES. Ripcord and Duke jump back. Ripcord glances at the underside of the pistol's magazine. Three words: "CAUTION: LIVE BOLTS". Both men watch Scarlett saunter back to the beginning of course, awestruck. Breaker walks by eating a burrito and watching his bio-rhythm display.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Aw, Ripcord's heart just skipped a beat. Isn't that sweet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is sinking, turning the dunes a brilliant orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security works a console in the Security Room. Their infrared monitors show a HERDSMAN AND HIS CAMELS walking across the desert dunes. A Technician taps some keys and X-RAY IMAGE shows the skeletal structures of the herdsman his camels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HERDSMAN walks across the desert with his CAMELS unde FULL MOON and a field of glittering stars. All of a sudde MULTIPLE MOUNDS OF SAND whip past his feet, almost knocki him over. He stares at them as they abruptly disappear deeper under the sand, like diving submarines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana drives the lead MOLE POD, an oblong-shaped digging de that is just large enough for her to fit inside. She watc her HUD relay information about her angle of decent and h distance to the target. Thirty yards...twenty yards...ten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light flashes on the console in the security room.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Sensors detecting seismic activity to the southwest. Probably just a tremor, but have a team check it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripcord and the other Joes watch as Duke and Snake-Eyes circle one another with special ELECTRIFIED PUGIL STICKS. Duke thrusts with a standard bayonet style move, Snake-Ey side steps it, spins his pugil stick above his head and brings it down on Duke's head with a sword-like stroke. A CRACKLING SHOCK is delivered and Duke goes down. The Joes grimace, feeling Duke's pain. Snake-Eyes turns away, done with him. Duke pops back up again.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Again. They go at each other, fast and furious, the electrified pugil sticks crackling and sparking. Duke spins and attem a stroke similar to Snake-Eyes' earlier move. Snake-Eyes blocks it, drops, and sweeps Duke's feet, taking him down hard before finishing him with another SPARKING HIT. Agai the Joes react. Snake-Eyes turns away. Duke shakes it off and pops to his feet once more.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again.

Snake-Eyes nods, a little more respect in his eyes now. T time after the high blows are parried, Snake-Eyes tries t sweep. Duke jumps it, rolls, comes up behind Snake-Eyes a STRIKES. Snake-Eyes barely blocks it. They trade half a dozen blows, the electricity popping and crackling before Snake-Eyes tries a finishing blow. Duke stuffs it with hi stick and tackles Snake-Eyes. They fall to the ground, bo receiving JOLTS. They go eye-to-eye. It wasn't pretty, bu Duke is getting effective. Snake-Eyes pops to his feet. This time he offers a hand to pull Duke up. Across the ro Hawk watches with approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge drill bit of Ana's mole machine bursts out of th reinforced clay wall, it opens and retracts, Ana rolls ou and drops to the ground. Another huge drill bursts out, i retracts and opens and Storm Shadow drops to the ground. They look around. They're between the clay wall and the ELECTRIFIED POWER GRID FENCE of the Pit's generator stati

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: The foundation of this fence is a hundred feet deep. No going under. Ten Neo-Viper mole pods start to burst out the wall. And then there's a crashing sound as one of the wall gird bends, obviously a mole machine in the clay behind it hit Ana can hear the engine grind to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we don't get him out he'll suffocate. Storm Shadow gives her a look: Like I care?

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just thought I'd mention it.

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW
dialogues.text: All that matters is the mission. Ana pulls out a hi-tech SCANNING DEVICE which shoots out STEEL BLUE BEAMS in a 360 DEGREE ARC, creating a DETAILED SCHEMATIC of the Pit, showing rooms and people moving abo them. She points down a tunnel beyond the electrified fen Storm Shadow gestures to one of the Neo-Vipers. The Man immediately walks over and grabs the fence, electricity J him violently, but the man ignores it and shakily starts climbing the fence. The skin on his hands and arms starts burn and bubble.

dialogues.speaker: STORM SHADOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Acceptable collateral damage.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: (trying to out-tough him) Is there any other? Near the top the Man finally falls backward and drops dow dead. Storm Shadow nods to the next Viper. Without hesitation the Man walks over and grabs the fence. He is immediately JOLTED, but keeps climbing, burning and bubbl This guy makes it to the top, throws himself over, and crashes to the ground, then crawls over and pulls the OFF SWITCH, cutting the electricity before dropping dead hims Ana, Storm Shadow and the others quickly scale the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An area where the Joe team chills. Duke and Ripcord enter sore and worked over. They move to some couches. Heavy Du grooves to the blasting Reggaeton classic "Salio El Sol".

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: You can learn a whole hell of a lot about a girl by the way she dances. Tell me I'm wrong Snake-Eyes. Snake-Eyes, sharpening his sword, barely looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? He agrees.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No, he doesn't. Do you? This time Snake-eyes looks up, his expression unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, he knows you have to listen to get to know someone. Right, Rip? Rip is happily stowing his liquid armor gear, glances ove

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: What? You say something? Breaker sits at a chessboard. Heavy D sits across from hi

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: Sorry, Scarlett, gotta go with Heavy D on this one. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like my man says, get a girl on the floor, you don't just see how she moves, you get the smell of her. What biologists tell us is that the decision is made by he nose long before the rest of the body gets involved. It's a question of pheromones.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You're going to teach me science? I read all about the positron emission tomography studies concerning sex pheromones when I was twelve. I'm just saying, it's not very romantic. Rip whispers to Duke, nodding towards Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Heavy told me she graduated college at twelve. No response from Duke, who is trying to get comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's like a freaky genius. A deadly, freaky genius.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You like her, I get it already.

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: (making a chess move) You can't learn this stuff in a book, Scarlett. You have to at least kiss a guy, before you're an expert on romance. The guys all laugh. Scarlett blushes, then raises her bow

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Who am I shooting first? The laughter stops. Rip looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: You haven't kissed anyone? Now Scarlett looks really furious. Rip instantly wishes h could take his words back. Duke just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Really firing on all cylinders there, Rip.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: All I know is, when the bass get's that booty shaking in the right way, I'm in the skin like a man named Flynn. Heavy Duty does a little freak dance. Scarlett makes a sh of disgust. Ripcord watches Scarlett, then makes a decisi

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Hell with it. He strides across the room toward Scarlett. Breaker notic

dialogues.speaker: BREAKER
dialogues.text: (to no one in particular) Into the Valley of Death rode the 600. Heavy Duty looks at him, confused. Breaker nods to Ripcor stopping near Scarlett's chair. Ripcord sees Snake-Eyes taking in his every move. Scarlett now has her nose in a book. Ripcord CLEARS HIS THROAT but she doesn't look up. peers closer and WE SEE THE COVER, on which, though in English, is a damn near INDECIPHERABLE SCIENTIFIC TITLE.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Beach reading, huh? She groans and lowers the book only slightly.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi, I guess we kinda got off on the wrong foot... Without changing expression she goes back to her book.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay look, I'm attracted to you. And you, you're attracted to me. And him-- (nods towards Snake-Eyes) The Zen Master, he creeps me out, but what I'm saying is--

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: "We're attracted to one another."

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That's what you're saying, not what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Okay, what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Attraction is an emotion. Emotions are not based in science. And if you can't quantify or prove that something exists, well, in my mind... it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: RIPCORD
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll get back to you on that. And he walks away scratching his head. Hawk steps in. Everyone comes to attention.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: Duke, You scored in the top half- percent of all people we've ever tested. Rip, well, if we average your scores with Duke's, you pass too. Welcome aboard, provisionally. But we still need to see if you pass muster in the field. Hawk gives them a nod. Duke and rip nod back with pride.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY DUTY
dialogues.text: YO JOE! Welcome aboard, boyz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana, Storm Shadow and the Neo-Vipers creep down the hallw Two GI JOE GUARDS come around a corner, before they can e react, Storm Shadow practically cuts them in two with his Katana sword. Ana Directs them down another hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOOR reads, "General Hawk". Cover Girl walks up and knocks. As she waits, we see a SHADOW moving behind her. Hawk opens the door. She hands him her POWERBOOK and a STYLUS.

dialogues.speaker: COVER GIRL
dialogues.text: Sorry to disturb you, general.

dialogues.speaker: HAWK
dialogues.text: That's all right, Cover Girl. What am I signing now? Cover Girl GASPS, a KATANA BLADE piercing out through her chest. She drops lifelessly, revealing Storm Shadow behin her. Hawk grabs a PISTOL, but Storm Shadow flashes his tw swords. One slices the barrel of the pistol clean off, th other buries itself in Hawk's gut. Hawk collapses. Ana steps forward and rips the General's SECURITY BADGE off h jacket. Hawk's eyes follow them as they leave. He glances at a RED BUTTON under his desk and struggles to reach it, giving everything he's got, until he finally hits the but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KLAXON BLARES. Duke, Ripcord and all the Joes leap up.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: The warheads. They all rush out of the doors. Breaker stops to change a chess piece on the board before racing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana swipes Hawk's SECURITY BADGE across the lock of the V DOOR. It opens. The weapons case sits on a table. She opens the case to check that the four warheads are inside, they shine on he glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Ripcord reach the main vault, armed only with th pistols. They find the INNER VAULT DOOR ajar. They approach, pushing back the door to discover that the plac empty and the weapons case is gone.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: They can't be far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the Neo-Vipers now reach the MOLE PODS and begin prepping them for escape. BOOM! A GRENADE slams into them killing them and destroying the pods. It's Heavy Duty wit his "MPL". Ana enters the room and quick-draws her PULSE PISTOL and blasts away. Heavy Duty dives behind cover, wh is blown away, knocking him out cold. Storm Shadow examines the ruined MOLE PODS, glancing arou his eyes falling on a pair of "ARCLIGHT" JET PACKS mounte a wall rack nearby. Storm Shadow strides to the nearest o and puts it on. Ana heads after him, still carrying the case. Suddenly, Duke and Ripcord rush up behind them, gun raised.
